frameDefinitions: In this frame a Theme moves in a certain Direction which is often determined by gravity or other natural, physical forces.
This frame concerns the appointment of a New_leader or removal from office of an Old_leader.
This frame describes a Theme losing its autonomy and perhaps sustaining material damage as the result of a successful invasion on the behalf of a Conqueror.
This frame involves a Creator making a duplicate, the Copy, of some Original entity.
A Destroyer (a conscious entity) or Cause (an event, or an entity involved in such an event) affects the Patient negatively so that the Patient no longer exists.

An Agent has attempted to achieve a Goal, and the actual outcome of the Agent's action has been resolved, so that it either specifically matches the Agent's intent (e.g. success) or does not match it (e.g. failure).
frameExamples: On March 17 , Mamedov <t>appointed</t> Rakhim Gasiyev as Defence Minister .
The Spaniards <t>conquered</t> the Incas with both the Cross and the arquebus
The teacher <t>copied</t> the problem onto the blackboard.
He <t>pulled</t> <t>off</t> his April Fool's Day prank by the barest of margins .
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the general <fen>Area</fen> in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up in (often unintentionally).
<fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels  or to a landmark past which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that changes location.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies before the Motion occurs.
The direction of motion of the <fen>Theme</fen>.  <fen>Direction</fen> characterizes the <fen>Path</fen> of motion according to some system of orientation, most often that imposed by gravity.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Motion occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where motion specified by <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> occurs.
The Selector (most commonly a group of people) is responsible for a change in leadership.  Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.

With words denoting removal (or attempted removal) from office of a leader, the <fen>Old_leader</fen> is typically the direct object of verbs, or occurs in a PP Complement with noun targets, frequently headed by the preposition <ment>against</ment>.
With words denoting appointment to a position, the <fen>New_leader</fen> is typically the object of verbs.

Frequently the <fen>Old_leader</fen> or <fen>New_leader</fen> is referred to only by his/her role. However, the <fen>Role</fen> can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement.
The role <fen>Old_order</fen> identifies the political order that existed before the change of leadership occurs.
The <fen>Function</fen> is the purpose the <fen>New_leader</fen> will fufill.
A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function of governance.
When the change takes place.
Where the change takes place.
The <fen>Conqueror</fen> is the entity that overtakes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the land, government, and its people that is seized by the <fen>Conqueror</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Conqueror</fen> seizes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Conqueror</fen> takes over the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Creator</fen> produces the <fen>Copy</fen> based on the <fen>Original</fen>.  It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
The <fen>Original</fen> is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object:
The <fen>Copy</fen> produced by the <fen>Creator</fen> is frequently not expressed. However, when <fen>Copy</fen> does occur, it is usually expressed as the External Argument of verbs:
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes <fen>Place</fen>.
The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the <fen>Patient</fen>'s destruction.
The entity which is destroyed by the <fen>Destroyer</fen>.
The event or entity which is responsible for the destruction of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Destroyer</fen> destroys the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Destroyer</fen> destroys the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
A participant function in a particular event or in events of a particular kind.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt succeeds or fails.
The place where an attempt succeeds or fails.
listRoleExamples: Soot-contaminated snow falls <fex>in Slovakia's mountainous regions</fex>.
The rivals both fell backwards <fex>into empty space</fex>.
The boys plummeted <fex>down the stairs</fex> into the basement.
In 1977, <fex> Nigel</fex> plunged to his death in his car on a mountain road in southern France.
The man toppled <fex>from the passenger seat</fex> into the road.
I hope your egg does n't fall <fex>down</fex> .
<fex>In 1977</fex> Nigel plunged to his death in his car on a mountain road in southern France.
<fex>In the kitchen</fex>, the towel dropped onto the floor.
<fex>The voters</fex> elected Blair.
The students overthrew <fex>the president</fex>.
The president appoints <fex>the prime minister</fex>.
The board of directors appointed Ashton <fex>Acting President</fex>.
The rebels overthrew <fex>the dictatorship</fex>.
His district elected her  <fex>to Congress</fex> three times.
The <fex>2000</fex> coup against the dictator was led by former president Smith.
The crew mutinied <fex>out in the middle of the Atlantic</fex>, the scoundrels.
<fex>The Achaemenid monarch Cambyses</fex> conquered Egypt in the year 525 BC
Britain had an opportunity to conquer <fex>Europe</fex>.
China 's <fex>1997</fex> takeover would push over 10 per cent of the population out of the colony
<fex>On Planet Earth</fex>, humans prefer to conquer those lands whose acquistion offers some economic benefit or advantage.
<fex>Pat</fex> photocopied the article.
Pat photocopied <fex>the article</fex>.
<fex>The results</fex> replicate those of an earlier study.
<fex>Who</fex> can unmake the ring?
Who can unmake <fex>the ring</fex>?
<fex>The subsequent explosions</fex> leveled most downtown office buildings.
<fex>John</fex> managed a feeble smile.
If you don't succeed <fex>in your subterfuge</fex>, then report back for further orders.
Benedikt was successful <fex>as a master brewer of beer</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he succeeded in putting the wig on the corpse.
